meanings.definition: To throw or swing a tomahawk as a weapon.
meanings.sent1: He was tomahawking the tomahawk at the target.
meanings.sent2: The warrior tomahawked the enemy with precision.
meanings.sent3: The tomahawking demonstration amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: She tomahawked her way through the dense forest of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The sound of tomahawking echoed through the battlefield.

meanings.definition: The act of using a tomahawk as a weapon.
meanings.sent1: The tomahawking of the weapon was swift and powerful.
meanings.sent2: He displayed skill in the tomahawking of the tomahawk.
meanings.sent3: The tomahawking competition drew a large crowd.
meanings.sent4: The tomahawking in the movie was intense and realistic.
meanings.sent5: The history museum showcased various tomahawkings from different eras.

meanings.definition: The motion of throwing or swinging a tomahawk.
meanings.sent2: The tomahawking of the weapon required strength and precision.
meanings.sent3: The tomahawking contest had participants from all over.
meanings.sent4: The tomahawking of emotions in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The tomahawking action in the game was exhilarating.
